item.title: Report E-2024070764
item.description:
Report E-2024070764

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1791 was punctured by a skid and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN1791-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071603
item.description:
Report X-2024071603

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat was found at door 125 in the load end ready to go to the next load point. The outbound sort manager walked passed it and noticed a very strong odor coming from the box. QA was contacted immediately to inspect the box. I noticed a little wet spot on one of the bottom corners of the package and brought it over to the office in a lined tote for further inspection. The inner drum seamed to have a poor quality closure that caused some of the contents to spill out and make it a little noticeable to the naked eye. Once the package was fully opened, the corrugated liner seamed to be wet also to confirm that the hazmat was damaged and could have possibly been damaged while it was on the vehicle when the driver returned from the pick up but could have dried do to the Acetone & Isopropyl Alcohol ingredient that makes up the product.

QA was contacted immediately to inspect the box. I noticed a little wet spot on one of the bottom corners of the package and brought it over to the office in a lined tote for further inspection. The inner drum seamed to have a poor quality closure that caused some of the contents to spill out and make it a little noticeable to the naked eye. Once the package was fully opened, the corrugated liner seamed to be wet also to confirm that the hazmat was damaged and could have possibly been damaged while it was on the vehicle when the driver returned from the pick up but could have dried do to the Acetone & Isopropyl Alcohol ingredient that makes up the product.

item.title: Report E-2024070659
item.description:
Report E-2024070659

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: AUSTINTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ADVANTAGE MANAGEMENT GROUP, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5215000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling westbound on I 76 near Austintown, Ohio. The KAG Energy, LLC unit drifted off the roadway and struck an abandoned vehicle on the shoulder of the highway. The KAG Energy, LLC unit then went off the roadway and rolled over. Approximately 4572 gallons of cutback asphalt was released. The released product impacted a nearby stream and reservoir. Hepaco Environmental and Enviroserve are continuing to remediate the site.

item.title: Report E-2024070065
item.description:
Report E-2024070065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: ASHTABULA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5010
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/26/2024, at 1048 hours, personnel in the CSXT Ashtabula Yard discovered TILX 113642, a residue tank car of Hydrochloric Acid, leaking from the protective housing area. The car was isolated and the shipper, INEOS, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0626-143). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the primary liquid line closure flange not properly prepared for transportation. Contractor personnel properly secured the closure and decontaminated the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Jeanne Kochevar (440-228-8373).
